title: Gilded Opera House Adventure #7
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Prima Donna's Dressing Room
rooms.description: An opulent dressing room with gilded mirrors, velvet curtains, and crystal chandeliers. The air smells of perfume and powder. Costumes hang on racks, and makeup covers an ornate vanity. A faded playbill is framed on the wall.

items.name: ornate vanity table
items.description: A marble-topped vanity with gold trim and three drawers

items.name: newspaper review
items.description: A yellowed newspaper clipping reviewing an opera performance
items.text: REVIEW: Carmen's triumphant premiere at our opera house in 1875! Composer Bizet's masterpiece in four acts captivated the audience. Maestro Fontaine conducted brilliantly, and the prima donna's performance was unforgettable.

items.name: framed playbill
items.description: An elegant playbill behind glass, advertising Carmen
items.text: TONIGHT ONLY: Carmen - An opera in four acts by Georges Bizet. Conducted by Maestro Fontaine. Stage Manager: Vittorio Rossi. Premiered 1875.

items.name: locked costume trunk
items.description: A large trunk with elaborate brass fittings and a keyhole shaped like a musical note

items.name: silver key
items.description: A delicate silver key with a treble clef design

items.name: backstage access pass
items.description: A laminated pass granting access to backstage areas

items.name: director's letter
items.description: A letter from the opera house director
items.text: My dear Prima Donna, remember that you are the star of this house. Maestro Fontaine leads the orchestra, Vittorio manages the stage, but you bring the magic. The grand stage awaits your return. - Director Alessandro

items.name: velvet jewelry box
items.description: A small box sitting on the vanity

items.name: golden opera mask brooch
items.description: A beautiful brooch shaped like a Venetian opera mask

items.name: dressing room door
items.description: A heavy wooden door with gold leaf decoration, leading to the backstage corridor

rooms.name: Backstage Corridor
rooms.description: A long hallway lined with portraits of famous performers and conductors. Gas lamps flicker along the walls. Props and set pieces are stored in alcoves. The corridor leads to the grand stage entrance, which is sealed with an ornate door bearing three questions.

items.name: portrait of Maestro Fontaine
items.description: An oil painting of a distinguished conductor holding a baton
items.text: Maestro Fontaine - Principal Conductor. Led the orchestra for 30 years. Known for his passionate interpretations and dedication to the musical arts.

items.name: portrait of Vittorio Rossi
items.description: A painting of a stern-looking man in formal attire
items.text: Vittorio Rossi - Stage Manager. Responsible for all backstage operations, set changes, and ensuring performances run smoothly. His office is located in the wings.

items.name: portrait of Director Alessandro
items.description: A grand portrait of an elegant gentleman in evening dress
items.text: Director Alessandro - Opera House Director. Oversees all artistic and administrative matters. His vision brought this opera house to international acclaim.

items.name: prop storage cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet filled with opera props and accessories

items.name: stage directions document
items.description: A worn document with notes about stage operations
items.text: STAGE OPERATIONS: All set changes coordinated by Stage Manager Rossi. His office in the wings contains emergency procedures. Remember: the conductor leads the music, the stage manager leads the production.

items.name: conductor's music stand
items.description: An ornate music stand with sheet music still on it
items.text: Sheet music for Carmen by Georges Bizet. Handwritten note: 'Maestro Fontaine's favorite - he conducted this masterpiece with unmatched passion.'

items.name: grand stage entrance
items.description: Massive double doors with gilded handles and carved musical motifs. A brass plaque displays three questions that must be answered to proceed.

password_questions.question: Who conducted the orchestra?
password_questions.hint: Check the portraits and playbill for the conductor's name

password_questions.question: Where is the stage manager's office?
password_questions.hint: The stage directions document mentions this location

password_questions.question: Who are you?
password_questions.hint: The director's letter reminds you of your role

rooms.name: Grand Stage
rooms.description: You step onto the magnificent grand stage of the opera house! The vast auditorium stretches before you with rows of red velvet seats rising to gilded balconies. The crystal chandelier sparkles overhead. Spotlights illuminate the stage, and the orchestra pit awaits. The exit doors at the back of the house stand open, leading to freedom.

items.name: grand crystal chandelier
items.description: A massive chandelier hanging above the auditorium, sparkling with thousands of crystals

items.name: orchestra pit
items.description: The sunken area before the stage where the orchestra performs

items.name: stage spotlight
items.description: Brilliant lights illuminating the stage in a warm glow

rooms.win_message: Bravo! You have reached the grand stage and taken your rightful place in the spotlight! The audience erupts in thunderous applause as you take your bow. The opera house doors open, and you exit triumphantly to freedom. The performance of a lifetime is complete. You win!
